intro: Macaranga punctata, commonly known as the veined paper plant, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a fast-growing shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins, and it produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Macaranga punctata is also known for its ability to form associations with ants, which contribute to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
